intro: Gilia tenuiflora var. latiflora, commonly known as the broad-flowered gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. The leaves are generally lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance.
